MUMBAI: The News Broadcasters Federation (NBF) has appealed to the prime
minister to reject the suggestion by Congress president Sonia Gandhi for a
“complete ban on media advertisements- television, print and online - by the
government and public sectors undertakings (PSUs) for a period of two years”.
The NBF also requests Gandhi to withdraw her suggestions in this regard.

[閱讀中文版本](http://www.humanresourcesonline.net/%e6%af%8f%e9%80%b1%e4%ba%ba%e5%8a%9b%e8%b3%87%e6%ba%90%e8%81%b7%e4%bd%8d%e8%ae%8a%e5%8b%95-dyson%e3%80%81%e7%a6%ae%e9%a0%93%e4%ba%9e%e6%b4%b2%e3%80%81%e5%98%89%e6%9f%8f%e7%92%b0/
"每週人力資源職位變動——Dyson、禮頓亞洲、嘉柏環球集團等")

Here are the major promotions and job moves in the world of HR for this week.

If you’ve been promoted or if you’ve moved to a new company, let us know and
we will announce your news here – just email
[wania@humanresourcesonline.net](mailto:wania@humanresourcesonline.net)

And for the pick of HR job opportunities in Asia check out HRjobs.

### HR practitioner appointments

**Joean Wong promoted to general manager, human resources**  
Leighton Asia has recently appointed Joean Wong as its general manager, human
resources. With close to 10 years of experience in HR, Wong has undertaken
senior human resources executive positions in the Asia region. She also holds
vast experience and exposure for the HR leadership/management in MNCs
including engineering consultants, financial services, professional accounting
services, Information technology and FMCG companies. Her specialties include
staffing, employee relations, coaching, career counselling, compensation and
benefits, learning and development, due diligence and HR transformation. She
is currently based in Hong Kong.

**Elena Ievleva joins Phaidon International**  
Phaidon International welcomes head of internal recruitment, operations
manager, Elena Ievleva in October. Phaidon International exists to enable
exceptional careers around the world; it connects exceptional talent, with
exceptional opportunities. Prior to this, Ievleva was working with The
Compliance Grid as a recruitment consultant. She started her HR career in
2014, where she was the search executive, headhunter at The Jace-Kelly
Leadership Acquisitions. She continues to be based in Hong Kong.

**Finian Toh promoted to director, human resources**  
After serving as associate director at Kerry Consulting for nearly four years,
Finian Toh has been promoted to director, human resources. Headquartered in
Singapore since 2003, Kerry Consulting is a headhunting firm. The diverse
clientele includes global and Asia-based companies. Kerry Consulting serves a
multicultural client base that encompasses mature markets and emerging
economies across Asia Pacific.

As a director, Toh brings a wealth of experience to his clients. He comes with
industry experience in his respective verticals before joining the search
industry. The Singapore based team is structured across both industry practice
groups and functional areas.

### HR solutions provider

**Frederic Lievre joins Oakwood Asia Pacific**  
Currently based in China, Frederic Lievre joins Oakwood Asia Pacific as its
general manager. Oakwood Asia Pacific, a member of Oakwood Worldwide, manages
Asia's finest serviced apartments for business and leisure travelers in
various countries including, China, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, and more.
Prior to this, Leivre was the general manager of Fosun Group where he re-
developed the iconic Jiangxi Fairy Lake Resort Area by merging six companies
owned by government and private entities into an efficient integrated
management company. Not only that, his last role saw him undertaking complex
project management to conceptualise, design, operate and market new leisure
attractions, including three new island destinations and Albion Fairy Lake
Resort & Spa.

**Royston Tan to lead health and benefits business**  
Willis Towers Watson recently announced the appointment of Royston Tan as head
of health & benefits, Hong Kong and North Asia (excluding China). Based in
Hong Kong, he reports to Cedric Luah, head of health and benefits, Asia and
Australasia. Royston’s key responsibility will be to deliver the regional
strategies of the Health & Benefits business in Hong Kong, Japan, Korea and
Taiwan. He will also build and strengthen client relationships by implementing
Willis Towers Watson’s proprietary Health & Benefits Target Operating Model,
as well as facilitate the development of client value propositions.

**Crown Worldwide Group announces new head of Crown Relocations**  
Sherry Liu has been appointed as group vice president, Crown Relocations. In
her new capacity, she will be leading the development and implementation of
Crown’s new propositions for the consumer market as part of Crown’s Customer
for Life initiatives.This new role is directly linked to Crown Relocations’
strategic objectives as the company continues to drive towards its 2020
vision.

Sherry brings a strong background from within the business, joining Crown in
1999. During her tenure she has held sales and general management roles with
increasing responsibilities spanning across the relocations, world mobility,
records management and fine art businesses. She has been involved in bringing
strategic global technology projects to life, providing superior value and
convenience to its customers. Sherry is also a key member of the executive
management group. She continues to be based in Hong Kong.

**Hudson RPO appoints new director, client solutions Asia**  
Hudson RPO has appointed Sid Suhas into the role of director, client solutions
Asia. Suhas is responsible for the expansion of Hudson’s RPO business
throughout Asia. He will lead the solution design process for clients by
understanding the core recruitment challenges for HR leaders and their
specific recruitment requirements. He will work with Hudson’s specialist RPO
team to develop bespoke recruitment solutions that transform the
organisation’s recruitment model.

Suhas has extensive experience in recruitment, leadership and business
development. His most recent role was leading Hudson’s Hong Kong and Southern
China recruitment business. Prior to that role, Suhas held a senior leadership
role in Hudson’s Singapore recruitment business.

**Kelly Services promotes Venus Chung**  
Venus Chung has been recently promoted to consultant at Kelly Services. In her
new role, she is specialised in distribution, she will be recruiting
professionals from agency, bancassurance and broker channels. In partnership
with its clients and candidates, Kelly Services provide tailor-made and
quality manpower solutions to each individual. Chung joined Kelly Services in
2016 and continues to be based in Hong Kong.

**Aisling Consulting welcomes two new members**  
Starting in October 2017, Rajiv Bhatia is executive director, at Aisling
Consulting - an outsourcing company under the Aisling Group. Rajiv comes with
over a decade of recruitment experience in the local and regional markets.
Prior to joining Aisling Consulting, he was director for outsourcing services
at Kelly Services. In his new role, his primary focus is to drive the business
forward to increase the company’s footprints across emerging markets. Other
than that, Rajiv has also worked with Manpower Group, Randstad Group & Allegis
Group, He continues to be based in Malaysia.

Meanwhile, Arzel Ramos has recently joined Aisling Consulting in Malaysia as
business lead for their ICT business division. Coming with more than a decade
of work experience, her current role will see her managing the information
technology team across Malaysia. Specialising in recruiting niche technical
roles within the IT industry, she will continue to provide solutions and
market analytics to clients. Arzel was previously working with Kelly Services
Malaysia for close to three years where she served as a senior technical
consultant. She is currently based in Malaysia.

If you’ve been promoted or if you’ve moved to a new company, let us know and
we will announce your news here – just email
[wania@humanresourcesonline.net](mailto:wania@humanresourcesonline.net).

And for the pick of HR job opportunities in Asia check out
[HRjobs](http://www.humanresourcesonline.net/hrjobs/).
